Literature Review: Soft actuators and robots enabled by additive manufacturing have revolutionized the field of robotics, offering a new paradigm for human-friendly and bioinspired systems. The use of soft materials and 3D printing has enabled the creation of multifunctional and multimaterial soft robots, which can mimic the complex motions of animals and operate in unstructured environments. This review provides an overview of the manufacturing methods for various types of soft robotic systems, including pneumatic, electrically activated, magnetically driven, and 4D-printed soft actuators and integrated soft actuators and sensors. The challenges and prospects of future research are also discussed, including the realization of multimaterial, multiscale, and multifunctional 3D-printed soft robots.
